item.title: Sony Interactive Entertainment and People Can Fly enter agreement for new game prototype based on Sony IP
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/03/sony-interactive-entertainment-and-people-can-fly-enter-agreement-for-new-game-prototype-based-on-sony-ip

People Can Fly has entered into an agreement with Sony Interactive Entertainment regarding the production of a prototype of a new game, codenamed “Project Delta,” based on an intellectual property belonging to Sony Interactive Entertainment, the company announced.

The developer will cooperate on production on a work-for-hire model, meaning that People Can Fly will work as a developer on behalf of Sony Interactive Entertainment, the publisher, and in return receive an agreed remuneration from Sony Interactive Entertainment.

Work on the game prototype will be divided into stages. According to People Can Fly, the scope and provisions of the agreement do not differ substantially from the provisions of production agreements normally entered into for this type of project.

Further details were not announced, but the language in the announcement is similar to People Can Fly’s 2023 announcement regarding an agreement with Microsoft regarding the production of “Project Maverick,” which was recently confirmed to be referencing its position as a co-development partner on Gears of War: E-Day. Taking that into account, it is currently unclear whether People Can Fly is the main developer of this Sony Interactive Entertainment project, or a co-development partner.

item.title: Star Wars: Hunters to end service on October 1
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/03/star-wars-hunters-to-end-service-on-october-1

  • PC
  • Smartphone
  • Switch

Final content update planned for April 15.

Zynga will end service for free-to-play arena shooter Star Wars: Hunter on October 1, the publisher announced. The game’s final content update will launch on April 15.

Star Wars: Hunters first launched for Switch, iOS via App Store, and Android via Google Play on June 4, 2024, followed by PC via Steam in Early Access on January 27, 2025.

Get the full message from Zynga below.

Dear Hunters,

Thank you for your incredible support and for being part of the world of Vespaara. After careful consideration, we want to let you know that the final content update for Star Wars: Hunters on all platforms will be on April 15. The game will remain playable until October 1, 2025, when the game’s online servers will be shut down.

We understand this news may be disappointing and want to assure you that this decision was not made lightly. Your passion and dedication to the game and its community have meant the world to us, and we are committed to providing visibility and updates throughout the transition process.

Please find below a few important dates regarding this announcement.

  • March 25, 2025 – Season 5 will be extended by three weeks. We will re-run events and shop bundles from the Season, and the Ranked Season will also be extended, giving players more time to hit Kyber 1 rank.
  • April 15, 2025 – Final content update will be released for free and in-game purchases will be disabled across all platforms. New Support Hunter, Tuya, will join the battle as part of the final update. Tuya will be available and playable for all users immediately at no cost, along with a slate of additional in-game content. We will continue to run a final Ranked Mode leaderboard for players to compete in and run all battlefields and game modes in rotation.
  • October 1, 2025 – Online servers will officially shut down, and Star Wars: Hunters will no longer be playable beyond this point.

Thank you for being a part of this incredible journey and for the time you’ve spent playing Star Wars: Hunters.

item.title: God of War Ragnarok ‘Dark Odyssey Collection’ update launches March 20 in celebration of series’ 20th anniversary
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/03/god-of-war-ragnarok-dark-odyssey-collection-update-launches-march-20-in-celebration-of-series-20th-anniversary

  • PC
  • PS4
  • PS5

New armor, appearances, and attachments.

Publisher Sony Interactive Entertainment and developer Santa Monica Studio will release a free update for God of War Ragnarok on March 20, adding the “Dark Odyssey” collection of armor, appearances, and attachments in celebration of the God of War series’ 20th anniversary, the companies announced.

Get the details below.

■ Dark Odyssey Collection – In-Game Update for God of War Ragnarok

  • Release Date: March 20

As a gift to everyone who owns God of War Ragnarok, on March 20 we will be releasing an update for all players on PlayStation and PC that includes the “Dark Odyssey” collection at no additional cost.

Inspired by the working name of God of War (2005) and the skin that originally appeared in God of War II as a reward for beating the game on God Mode difficulty, we are bringing the classic black and gold theme for the 20th anniversary.

Once the update is live, you’ll be able access the collection below from any Lost Items chest in the base game or automatically while in Valhalla.

Dark Odyssey Armor and Appearance for Kratos

  • Dark Odyssey Kratos Appearance
  • Dark Odyssey Armor Set for Kratos
    • Dark Odyssey Breastplate
    • Dark Odyssey Bracers
    • Dark Odyssey Belt

Dark Odyssey Companion Armor

  • Dark Odyssey Vestment for Atreus
  • Dark Odyssey Witch Frock for Freya

Dark Odyssey Weapon Appearances & Attachments*

  • Dark Odyssey Leviathan Axe (Appearance) and Dark Odyssey Knob (Attachment)
  • Dark Odyssey Blades of Chaos (Appearance) and Dark Odyssey Handles (Attachment)
  • Dark Odyssey Draupnir Spear (Appearance) and Dark Odyssey Hind (Attachment)

Dark Odyssey Shield Appearances and Rond

  • Dark Odyssey Guardian Shield (Appearance)
  • Dark Odyssey Dauntless Shield (Appearance)
  • Dark Odyssey Stone Wall Shield (Appearance)
  • Dark Odyssey Shatter Start Shield (Appearance)
  • Dark Odyssey Onslaught Shield (Appearance)
  • Dark Odyssey Spartan Aspis Shield (Appearance)
  • Dark Odyssey Rond

*Please note, the weapon appearances are made for the fully upgraded version of each weapon and will only be available for use upon reaching that upgrade.

Edit Appearance for Weapon and Shield Attachments

With the addition of the new Dark Odyssey weapon attachments and shield rond in the upcoming patch on March 20, we will add the ability to use the “Edit Appearance” feature on those components of Kratos’ arsenal.

You’ll be able to pick whatever visual suits your look with the functionality you want for your build.

Other initiatives announced for the series’ 20th anniversary include an art exhibition at Gallery Nucleus in Los Angeles, a retrospective book by Dark Horse Books, a print collection by Cook and Becker, a Jormungandr plush by Fangamer, a vinyl collection by Laced Vinyl, and a t-shirt collection by Insert Coin. Read more about those here. Additionally, both God of War (2018) and God of War Ragnarok are currently on sale at a discount price until March 20. The PlayStation versions are available via PlayStation Plus.

God of War Ragnarok is available now for PlayStation 5, PlayStation 4, and PC via Steam and Epic Games Store.
